title: Tirana Residents Gather Outside After Earthquake Shakes Albanian City
text:
An earthquake with a recorded magnitude of 5.6 hit Albania on September 21, shaking Tirana and the port town of Durres.

Local media reported that at least 68 people were taken to hospital with injuries, but none of the reported injuries were serious.

This video shows residents in Tirana’s Yzberisht district assembling outside away from buildings after the earthquake hit the city.

Reuters reported that the earthquake struck 19 miles (30 kilometers) west of Tirana, and that one apartment building in Durres was severely damaged. Credit: Nadia Lika via Storyful
